article.title: Nuclear Data and Fuel/Assembly Manufacturing Uncertainties Analysis and Preliminary Validation of SUACL

multiple_choice_question.text: Which uncertainty source contributes the MOST to the uncertainty in k<sub>eff</sub> for the TMI-1 cell based on both SUACL and SAINT calculations?
What does the figure primarily illustrate regarding the uncertainty results from ENDF/B-VII.1 and JENDL4.0?
choices: Both libraries produce almost identical uncertainty values for all parameters.
Discrepancies between the libraries\' uncertainty contributions are most significant for <sup>235</sup>U fission yield (ν).
JENDL4.0 consistently shows higher uncertainties compared to ENDF/B-VII.1.
The differences in uncertainty values between the libraries are generally small.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which statement about the uncertainty of k<sub>eff</sub> in the TMI-1 cell is supported by the data in Table V?
choices: The uncertainty contribution from <sup>1</sup>H capture cross section is negligible.
SUACL and SAINT show substantial disagreement in their uncertainty estimates.
TSUNAMI predicts a significantly lower uncertainty compared to SUACL and SAINT.
The uncertainty contribution from <sup>235</sup>U fission yield (ν) varies significantly depending on the covariance data source.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which nuclide\'s capture cross section contributes the MOST to the uncertainty in k<sub>eff</sub> for the MOX cell based on the SUACL (ENDF/B VII.1) calculations?
